contentrichtext.text: {{Cookbook}} [[Image:Succotash.jpg|thumb|250px|A succotash prepared with kidney beans.]] '''Succotash''' (from [[Narragansett language|Narragansett]] ''msíckquatash'', "boiled corn kernels"<ref name="M-W">{{cite web | title = succotash | url = http://www.merriam-webster.com/dictionary/succotash | publisher = Merriam-Webster Online Dictionary | year = 2008 | accessdate = 2008-12-07 }}</ref>) is a food dish consisting primarily of [[Maize|corn]] and [[lima bean]]s or other [[Common bean#Shell beans|shell beans]].<ref name="M-W"/> Other ingredients may be added including tomatoes<ref name="AH">{{cite book | chapter = succotash | title = The American Heritage Dictionary of the English Language | edition = 4 | publisher = Houghton Mifflin Company | year = 2004 | accessdate = 2009-02-21 | url = http://dictionary.reference.com/browse/succotash }}</ref> and green or sweet red peppers.<ref name="Dictionary.com">{{cite book | chapter = succotash | title = Dictionary.com Unabridged (v 1.1) | publisher = Random House, Inc. | date = 2009-02-21 | accessdate = 2009-02-21 | url = http://dictionary.reference.com/browse/succotash }}</ref> Because of the relatively inexpensive and more readily available ingredients, the dish was popular during the [[Great Depression]] in the [[United States]]. It was sometimes cooked in a [[casserole]] form, often with a light pie crust on top as in a traditional [[pot pie]]. Succotash is a traditional dish of many [[Thanksgiving]] celebrations in [[New England]]<ref>Morgan, Diane and John Rizzo. ''The Thanksgiving Table: Recipes and Ideas to Create Your Own Holiday Tradition''. Pg. 122.</ref> as well as in [[Pennsylvania]] and other states. In some parts of the [[American South]], any mixture of [[vegetable]]s prepared with lima beans and topped with [[lard]] or [[butter]] is called succotash. The native Americans in the eastern woodlands were the first to prepare this dish. =="Sufferin' succotash"== "Sufferin' succotash" is a [[catchphrase]] of the [[Warner Bros.]] cartoon cat [[Sylvester (Looney Tunes)|Sylvester]],<ref>[http://www.best-cat-art.com/sylvester-the-cat.html Sylvester the Cat - A Favorite Cartoon Cat]</ref> also used less often by [[Daffy Duck]]. The Depression-era exclamation is said to be a [[minced oath]] of "suffering [[Redeemer (Christianity)|savior]]". ==See also== *[[A Key into the Language of America]] == References == {{reflist}} == Further reading == * {{cite book | title = The Story of Corn | last = Harper Fussell | first = Betty | publisher = UNM Press | year = 2004 | isbn = 0-8263-3592-6 | pages = 184–185 | url = http://books.google.com/books?id=iAsQ0Pn1_0MC&lpg=PP1&pg=PA184#v=onepage&q=&f=false }} ==External links== * [http://www.beansbeansbeans.com/summer-succotash-recipe How to Make Succotash] {{Legume dishes}} [[Category:Narragansett tribe]] [[Category:Native American cuisine]] [[Category:Legume dishes]] {{food-stub}}
